vector-prime.title: Vector: Prime
vector-prime.description: A group of friends including @Datman101 and I created this game in a single week for Brackeys Game Jam 2021.2. What do you think of it?
vector-prime.body:
You are living. Living a normal, boring 9-5 life. Surviving. Until a mystical Artificial Intelligence abducts you claiming that your world is fake, and merely a program that is about to be destroyed by the very race who made it, the 'Ascended'. Run and jump your way through multiple procedurally-generated DOS attacks on your worlds' weakest structural points, to save everything and everyone you know and love...

A group of friends including @Datman101 and I created this game in a single week for Brackeys Game Jam 2021.2. Please rate it here on itch.io if you can and comment to tell us what you like about it!
vector-prime.authors: A group of my friends (including @Datman101) and me

youareacat.title: You Are A Cat! Game
youareacat.description: In this videogame, you are a cat exploring a world of pixels!
youareacat.body:
Play the free game below!

You can play in singleplayer or multiplayer and discover new biomes! How far can you explore?

guessthehexcolour.title: Guess the HEX colour!
guessthehexcolour.description: A python game which tests your knowledge of HEX colours...
guessthehexcolour.body:
How to play:

  1. Open the game here and click Run.
  2. Type how many colours you want to guess in the Python console.
  3. Search the internet for a "HEX colour picker" and try to make it match the colour displayed in the console.
  4. Type the HEX code (look on the colour picker - the code is something like #8f4d90) into the console. Don't type the "#"; it is already there.
  5. Once you have guessed all the colours, look at the console for your score! How well did you do?

What are HEX Codes?

HEX Codes are colour codes used in web development to specify specific colours in CSS for elements.

turingtape.title: TuringTape
turingtape.body:
This project is a tribute to the computer scientist Alan Turing, and is a simulation of a machine in one of his thought experiments. When you are writing the algorithm, hover over a field to see what it is.

The Code and The Project

Open project in a new tab

namethecolourproject.title: Name the Colour!
namethecolourproject.description: A PHP project where you can name colours yourself and put them on the server!
namethecolourproject.body:
Use the colour picker to find your colour, then choose a creative name and submit the form! You can search the database, too.

This uses PHP, a server-side programming language that edits a text file on the server to change the database.

Font from Google Fonts

unicodechargenerator.title: Unicode Character Generator
unicodechargenerator.description: Every character on a computer has a code, which you can find out!

hashtagfinder.title: Hashtag Finder
hashtagfinder.description: Search lots of social media platforms for a hashtag in just two clicks!

safekey.title: SafeKey File Encrypter
safekey.description: Encrypt files with a key only you know!
safekey.body: Please note: I cannot ensure that this is perfectly secure as your browser would have access to the key while you are using this.

battlepythonconsole.title: Battle! - Python Console Game
battlepythonconsole.description: Choose the characteristics of two characters, and make them battle in the Python console!

cssonlygame.title: Bubbles - the CSS-only game
cssonlygame.description: A game made with only pure HTML and CSS...
cssonlygame.body:
CSS is so powerful; you can even make a game with it! That's what I did...

Press Play to play the game in the frame below, and try to pop (click), as many bubbles as you can in the 10-second time limit!

Play

phrasetogradient.title: Phrase To Gradient
phrasetogradient.description: An AI which converts phrases, words and numbers you type to a gradient - Each phrase has its unique gradient!
phrasetogradient.body: Warning: If you do not want to see quickly changing colours, please do not type in the box.
